p: Indeed, the EOs obtained from different parts of T. satureioides were evaluated against several pathogenic bacteria known by their drug multiresistance, including Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Escherichia coli, Acinetobacter baumannii, and methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA). Table 3 summarizes the published works that investigated the antibacterial activities of T. satureioides. It lists the parts used, the tested extracts, the methods used, the tested strains, and the main results obtained.
